modules.description: The module provides pretty-printing and string conversion operations for abstract syntax tree (AST) nodes, targeting types like expressions, statements, modules, and error-handling constructs. It serializes structured elements such as numeric literals, function arguments, and pattern-matching components into human-readable formats, aiding in debugging and error reporting. These utilities are particularly useful during AST manipulation or analysis, where inspecting node structures is critical for tasks like code transformation or static analysis.

Parses Python source code into an abstract syntax tree (AST) representation, handling recoverable errors during parsing. Works with string inputs and produces a result containing either the parsed module and a list of errors, or a fatal error message. Useful for analyzing or transforming Python code programmatically, such as in linters or code refactoring tools.

This module provides AST pretty-printing and Python source parsing with error recovery. It works with AST nodes, Python source strings, and error-handling constructs. Concrete use cases include debugging AST transformations, building linters, and implementing code analysis tools that require inspecting or manipulating Python syntax structures.
